alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL MORA COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 515 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of La Cueva, or 14 miles east of Mora, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mora, La Cueva, Ledoux, Ojo Feliz, Guadalupita, El Turquillo, Golondrinas, Luceros and Rainsville. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 14 and 18. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 15. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 21 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands
